main event: A round, milky-white object the size of a basketball at arm's length was observed over Pascagoula, Mississippi on October 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for 5-10 minutes, then moved across the sky in a smooth circular path at an 'extremely fast' speed.
Other similar sightings of glowing, maneuverable lights were reported in the area around the same time.
The sighting lasted for about 22 minutes.
The object made no sound and did not appear to be rotating.
The object was estimated to be somewhat larger than a basketball and had a dull, metallic appearance.
witnesses: multiple witnesses, including a housewife and a draftsman
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
